title: Coupang Data Breach (33 Million Customers)
summary: South Korean e-commerce leader Coupang revealed a massive data breach affecting over 33 million users. The incident exposed personal information (names, contact details, possibly payment data) of roughly two-thirds of Korea's population. Korean regulators launched special audits and investigations into Coupang's data practices. The attack caused public outcry and led to legal and financial scrutiny including government-ordered tax audit.

aiAnalysis.summary: South Korean e-commerce leader Coupang revealed a massive data breach affecting over 33 million users. The incident exposed personal information (names, contact details, possibly payment data) of roughly two-thirds of Korea's population. Korean regulators launched special audits and investigations into Coupang's data practices. The attack caused public outcry and led to legal and financial scrutiny including government-ordered tax audit.

summary: A significant ransomware attack targeted a major healthcare provider, compromising patient data and disrupting hospital operations across multiple facilities.

title: Oracle EBS Hack - University of Pennsylvania Data Breach
summary: Cl0p ransomware group's Oracle E-Business Suite (EBS) hack campaign hit University of Pennsylvania and University of Phoenix. UPenn attack exposed personal data (names, SSNs) of thousands of individuals after hackers exploited an EBS zero-day. Over 100 organizations including Harvard, Dartmouth, Canon, Mazda, and Logitech were named as victims of the same Oracle EBS exploit.

aiAnalysis.summary: Cl0p ransomware group's Oracle E-Business Suite (EBS) hack campaign hit University of Pennsylvania and University of Phoenix. UPenn attack exposed personal data (names, SSNs) of thousands of individuals after hackers exploited an EBS zero-day. Over 100 organizations including Harvard, Dartmouth, Canon, Mazda, and Logitech were named as victims of the same Oracle EBS exploit.

summary: European data protection authority issues record-breaking fine for GDPR violations related to inadequate data security measures.

summary: Major cryptocurrency exchange reports security breach resulting in theft of millions in digital assets.

title: New Malware Campaign Targets Norwegian Businesses
summary: Security researchers identify new malware campaign specifically targeting small and medium-sized businesses in Norway.

title: F5 Networks Cyberattack (BIG-IP Source Code Theft)
summary: F5 Networks announced that a sophisticated nation-state actor breached its internal systems, stealing portions of proprietary BIG-IP source code and details of undisclosed vulnerabilities. The attacker maintained long-term access to F5's networks. U.S. CISA issued emergency directive warning of urgent patching for F5 products. The theft potentially empowered attackers to develop new exploits against hundreds of thousands of enterprise networks.

aiAnalysis.summary: F5 Networks announced that a sophisticated nation-state actor breached its internal systems, stealing portions of proprietary BIG-IP source code and details of undisclosed vulnerabilities. The attacker maintained long-term access to F5's networks. U.S. CISA issued emergency directive warning of urgent patching for F5 products. The theft potentially empowered attackers to develop new exploits against hundreds of thousands of enterprise networks.

title: Collins Aerospace Ransomware Attack (vMUSE)
summary: Ransomware attack on Collins Aerospace's vMUSE check-in software paralyzed flight operations at major European airports (Heathrow, Brussels, Berlin, Dublin). The shared check-in/boarding platform went offline, forcing thousands of passengers to be processed manually causing widespread delays and flight cancellations. EU's cybersecurity agency confirmed it was a ransomware incident.

aiAnalysis.summary: Ransomware attack on Collins Aerospace's vMUSE check-in software paralyzed flight operations at major European airports (Heathrow, Brussels, Berlin, Dublin). The shared check-in/boarding platform went offline, forcing thousands of passengers to be processed manually causing widespread delays and flight cancellations. EU's cybersecurity agency confirmed it was a ransomware incident.

title: Google Salesforce Data Breach
summary: Google disclosed that hackers from ShinyHunters group breached one of its Salesforce customer databases using social-engineering (voice-phishing). The attackers accessed a database of small and medium-business contact information. The breach exposed basic company contact details (names, emails, phone numbers) for millions of Google's customers, but reportedly not financial or login credentials.

aiAnalysis.summary: Google disclosed that hackers from ShinyHunters group breached one of its Salesforce customer databases using social-engineering (voice-phishing). The attackers accessed a database of small and medium-business contact information. The breach exposed basic company contact details (names, emails, phone numbers) for millions of Google's customers, but reportedly not financial or login credentials.

title: Microsoft SharePoint 'ToolShell' Zero-Day Attacks
summary: Series of attacks exploited zero-day vulnerabilities in on-premises Microsoft SharePoint servers. Over 400 organizations including U.S. government agencies were compromised in this campaign. Attackers deployed web shells to gain admin access and exfiltrated sensitive internal data (documents, credentials). Intrusions attributed to advanced threat groups likely based in China.

aiAnalysis.summary: Series of attacks exploited zero-day vulnerabilities in on-premises Microsoft SharePoint servers. Over 400 organizations including U.S. government agencies were compromised in this campaign. Attackers deployed web shells to gain admin access and exfiltrated sensitive internal data (documents, credentials). Intrusions attributed to advanced threat groups likely based in China.

title: Historic 16 Billion-Credential Leak
summary: Unprecedented data dump of ~16 billion stolen credentials surfaced. Not a single breach but a compilation of stolen usernames, emails, and passwords gathered over years by infostealer malware on over 750 million infected devices. Dataset included logins for Google, Facebook, Apple, Netflix, and numerous government portals, enabling massive credential-stuffing and phishing campaigns worldwide.

aiAnalysis.summary: Unprecedented data dump of ~16 billion stolen credentials surfaced. Not a single breach but a compilation of stolen usernames, emails, and passwords gathered over years by infostealer malware on over 750 million infected devices. Dataset included logins for Google, Facebook, Apple, Netflix, and numerous government portals, enabling massive credential-stuffing and phishing campaigns worldwide.

title: Marks & Spencer Supply-Chain Ransomware Attack
summary: UK retail giant Marks & Spencer suffered a large cyberattack by Scattered Spider group, who deployed DragonForce ransomware. The attackers encrypted M&S's critical systems and stole sensitive customer data. The disruption was severe with M&S projecting a £320 million ($400 million) hit to profits due to lost sales and recovery costs.

title: NASCAR Ransomware Attack
summary: Medusa ransomware group infiltrated NASCAR's systems, claiming to have exfiltrated roughly 1 terabyte of data including personal information like names and Social Security numbers. The group demanded a $4 million ransom. NASCAR confirmed the cybersecurity incident affecting operations and notified individuals that personal data was stolen.

title: Oracle Cloud IAM Data Breach
summary: Threat actor 'rose87168' claimed to breach Oracle Cloud's Identity and Access Management service. About 6 million user records (usernames, emails, hashed passwords) were allegedly stolen from roughly 140,000 Oracle cloud tenant accounts. Oracle denied customer data compromise, but security firms warned this could be one of the year's most significant cloud supply-chain attacks.

aiAnalysis.summary: Threat actor 'rose87168' claimed to breach Oracle Cloud's Identity and Access Management service. title: Phemex Cryptocurrency Exchange Hack
summary: Singapore-based crypto platform Phemex was breached with attackers stealing at least $69 million. The hack forced Phemex to halt withdrawals and deposits while assessing damage. Investigation found hackers compromised Phemex's systems, leading to loss of user funds and widespread service disruption.

aiAnalysis.summary: Singapore-based crypto platform Phemex was breached with attackers stealing at least $69 million. The hack forced Phemex to halt withdrawals and deposits while assessing damage.
